item.title: JavaBase - open irc bot
item.dc:creator: @BAsh BAsh
item.description:
@BAsh wrote:

[quote=“yakman, post:20, topic:247780”]JPanel isnt used for anything except making a nice layout, all the JPanels are local variables in the createAndShowGUI() method. Also JTabbedPane isnt used at all.

i guess i could subclass JTree, JTextArea or DefaultMutableTreeNode, but if i subclassed one, all the rest would have only one instance which would then be pointless to have as non-static.

btw the code is from here[/quote]
Maybe I wasn’t clear. You subclass JPanel or JComponent and in the constructor of the subclass you add all the subelements such as buttons and the like. These sub-elements aren’t defined as static elements of the main class but as instances in the subclass.

Look at JFileChooser. While it can be used by itself in a frame it is actually a subclass of JComponent allowing you to put it in your own frame with your own elements around it.

if theres only ever one instance of GoodExample, whats the point of making it non-static?

unless you need it because it implements ActionListener or something like that, but if that doesnt happen, whats the point?
[/quote]What’s the point of making it static?[/quote]

with static you can access fields and methods from other classes without accessing it through a static field or making yourself pass the instance to every constructor.

static stuff are better then…

MyMainClass._instance.someField/Method()

and

private MyMainClass instance;

public OtherClass(MyMainClass instance) {
    this.instance = instance;
    this.instance.someField/Method()
}

cleaner.

MyMainClass.someField/Method()

/*
* instances of thread classes
*/
private static LocalPortBindThread portListener;
private static OutgoingDataWritingThread dataSender;
private static IncomingDataReadThread dataReceiver;
private static PingControlThread pingControl;
private static IncomingPacketProcessThread packetProcessor;
private static SocketConnector remoteConnector;

/*
 * GUI components
 */
private static JFrame frame;
private static JSplitPane splitPane;
private static JTextArea messageArea;
private static JScrollPane transcriptScroller;
private static JTextField messageInput, hostInput;
private static JButton connectButton, sendButton, newNickButton;
public static JCheckBox listenCheckBox;
private static JProgressBar connectProgress;
private static JLabel peerCountLabel;

/*
 * for when the message area or main tree is right clicked
 */

private static JMenuItem copyMenuItem;
private static JMenuItem clearMenuItem;
private static JPopupMenu treeMenu;
private static JMenuItem pingMenuItem;
private static JMenuItem disconnectMenuItem;
private static Peer clickedPeer; //peer that was right-clicked on the treeMenu

 */

/**
 * peer instance which represents us.
 */
private static Peer rootPeer;

/**
 * root of the main tree, same as rootPeer.treeNode
 */
private static DefaultMutableTreeNode rootNodePeer;

/**
 * JDOM class which formats xml
 */
private static XMLOutputter xmlOut;

/**
 * JDOM class which builds an object model from a data stream
 */
private static SAXBuilder saxBuilder;

 * peerList contains all peers, IncomingDataReadThread.inQueue contains only
 * those which are directly connected
 * must be synchronized cause its accessed by a few threads
 * this should probably be changed into a hashmap
 */

/**
 * port to connect through
 */
